concise_definition: n. 代表, 代理人, 议员

definitions.explanation_en: A person who is authorized to act on behalf of another person, group, or organization, often to speak, negotiate, or make decisions in their interest.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指被授权代表他人、团体或组织行事的人，通常为其利益发言、谈判或做决定。
definitions.example_en: The union sent three representatives to negotiate better working conditions.
definitions.example_cn: 工会派了三名代表来谈判更好的工作条件。

definitions.explanation_en: A member of a legislative body, especially in a representative democracy, elected by the people to voice their views and make laws on their behalf.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在代议制民主国家中，由人民选举出来代表其意见并为其制定法律的立法机构成员，尤指众议员。
definitions.example_en: Each state elects several representatives to serve in the U.S. House of Representatives.
definitions.example_cn: 每个州选举若干名代表进入美国众议院任职。

definitions.explanation_en: An example or embodiment of a particular type, quality, or group, serving as a typical or characteristic instance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某种类型、特质或群体的典型代表或体现，作为具有代表性的实例。
definitions.example_en: She is a representative of the new generation of tech entrepreneurs.
definitions.example_cn: 她是新一代科技企业家的典型代表。

comparison.analysis: “Delegate”（代表/被委派者）通常指被正式授权代表他人参与特定会议或任务，强调临时性或任务导向的授权，如国际会议代表。而 “representative” 更常用于长期或制度化的代表角色，如议员或公司员工代表，范围更广。
“Agent”（代理人）强调在法律或商业关系中代表他人执行具体事务，常带有契约性或专业服务性质（如房地产经纪人）。而 “representative” 更侧重于表达意见、利益或立场，不一定涉及法律授权或交易行为。
“Emissary”（特使）是外交语境中由政府或权威机构派出的高级代表，通常用于敏感或正式的国际谈判，带有高度象征性和权威性。相比之下，”representative“ 更日常、更广泛，不局限于外交场合。
